channel.title: Sketchup on Hugo Cactus Theme
channel.description: Recent content in Sketchup on Hugo Cactus Theme

item.title: Desk Clock Rendering
item.description:
I was fascinated by a post by Google’s SketchUp blog, which announced a contest based on rendering scenes with Maxwell rendering software. There are many free/paid solutions, but out of the few that I tried, the free version of Maxwell seems to offer the least amount of fuss as far as installation and setup. The full version is only $99, so it’s a steal compared to some of the other professional solutions available. Here is my first attempt at rendering [this][1].

Disclaimer: I still have very little idea of what 90% of the settings are actually for. One day I plan to dig deep into the documentation to learn what I am actually manipulating.

item.title: Desk Clock
item.description:
I use SolidWorks at my workplace for 3D modeling. It is intuitive, powerful and extremely expensive. I can’t quite justify the use of a multi-thousand dollar license for personal use. Hence, I’ve used Google SketchUp for hobby modeling. One day, I may spring for the professional version, and at $500, it is a steal compared to a basic seat of SolidWorks. From time to time, I will share some of my designs.

Here is desk clock that I modeled:

I opted for an aluminum finish with a basic monochrome LCD display projecting on a glass surface. For a minimalist appearance, I chose to use two buttons, one for the hour and the other for minutes.
